Text:
In a certain forest, as a trainee in the Crimson
Order, Alexia joins in a mission to defeat a group
of bandits.

...So, you're sure the bandits are hiding in this
forest?

Indeed. Based on eyewitness reports, the bandits
headed east from this location. They've likely
established their hideout deep within the forest.

In that case, should we encircle the area to prevent
them from escaping? That said, given our current
numbers, that could pose a challenge...

Let's split up into two groups and send a request for
reinforcements to the main party. Those remaining
can search for their hideout—

There's no time for that. I suggest we locate their
hideout immediately and strike while the iron is hot.

Princess Alexia... I understand your perspective,
but we should opt for the most certain approach.

(Surrounding the forest and blocking the roads?
The enemy must know this forest inside and out.
The terrain is overwhelmingly in their favor.)

(Splitting up the squad would play right into their
hands. In that case...)
...I'll take out the enemy myself!

What?! Huh!? P-Princess Alexia, please come back!
It's too dangerous!
What reckless behavior...

...Looks like I've ventured quite deep into the
forest. It's about time one of the bandits made
an appearance...
(...Right on cue.)
Show yourself! I know you're there!
Hey hey... You're quite the spirited young lass.

Came all this way just to become our hostage,
did you? Thanks for saving us the trouble.

(There are seven...no, maybe eight of them. They're
coming out of the woodwork, just as I expected.)
(Hehe... This reminds me of that one time.)

Huh? What're you laughing about? Have we frightened
you into losing your mind?
Me...? Frightened...?

(...It's true. I was frightened back then. Surrounded
by those who called themselves the Shadow Garden.
Feeling helpless and desperate... But!)
I'm not who I was back then!
Aaghhh! Wh-What the hell...are you doing?!

Isn't it obvious? I'm giving you bastards a
thrashing!
You've got some nerve...! Boys! Attack!
Aaaghhh!
D-Damn it...

Drop the tough act. Cease your senseless resistance
and surrender quietly—

Just then, a single gunshot rings out from behind
Alexia.
Huh?!

I'm impressed, young lady. I thought I had shattered
your dominant arm with that shot.
B-Boss!

Oh...so you're the boss, huh? Shooting from a hidden
spot is just the kind of tired trope I'd expect from
a villain.

Hahaha! And that's exactly the kind of line I'd
expect from a knight on their last leg...or arm.

You really shouldn't be blaming others for your own
weakness. It's your fault for not sensing my presence,
missy.
Ack...!

Oh? Managed to dodge that one, huh? Guess you're not
just playing dress-up as a knight.

But how long can you keep it up? I might have just
grazed you, but you've got no chance without the
use of your dominant arm.
Agh!
See? Bullseye. Now both your arms are useless.

...Keep talking. You think you've beaten me just
because you've scratched my shoulder? Don't
make me laugh.
Feisty. Let's see how long you can keep up that act.

I'll have you know that I'm an accomplished gunner
who's led a hundred men. So, where should I shoot
next? Your pretty legs, or should I blow a hole in
your head?
Ack...! *pant*...*pant*...
Hahah! Giving up already?

...I guess so. You're a tough one to beat...and I
can't keep dodging your bullets forever.

Yup, that's right. A young lady like yourself
shouldn't be trying to take on bandits in the
first place.
Don't worry. It'll all be over soon.
I guess...I'm still the same person I used to be.
Hah! Not in a thousand years!

Aghh...?! You...tricked me?! Damn you, resorting to
dirty tricks!
Right back at you!

It's pointless! Your sword technique is far too
average. You know what they call swordplay
like yours? Amateur!
...And what's so bad about amateur swordplay?

(I don't require talent, strength, or speed for my
ideal swordplay. All I need is to work hard and
practice!)
I won't let you...belittle my efforts!

Argh... This can't be! How could I lose...to a mere
g-girl?!
(...I wonder if this is how Shadow felt back then.)

I thought you were going to hit me, Mr. Next-Gen
Rounds.

...I thought you were going to shoot me,
Mr. Hundred-Man Gunner.
You...braaaaat!!!
Your aim is all over the place. Time to end this!
Gyaaaagh!
As you said, my swordplay is that of an amateur.

But...I will never think of my swordplay as something
useless again.
I will master this technique!
